page.name: legend
page.content:
Thematic Legend


Your map legend is dynamic- if you change the data you’re mapping this legend will also update. The information displayed tells you what the color ranges on the map correspond to in your data- typically lighter means less of something, darker show more. The year the data represent and the source are also shown- if you want to see more details about the data source just click on that text and a metadata page will popup.


You have three main options to alter both this legend and the map:

1. You can Change Map details- colors, ranges, transparency, the year of the data
2. Show the Data on a chart- opens an interactive histogram (a bar graph that shows the distribution of the info)
3. Remove the Layer- if you’re done with this map just hit this to clear it and continue with a new map


Along the top of the Thematic Legend window are icons that let you:

_______Return to the Main Legend

______Go to the Print Map Customizer

page.name: edit
page.content:
Thematic Legend Editor


On this page you can edit how the data is classified and displayed on the map.

1. Use the category selector to show between 3 and 7 data ranges for the data.

2. Use the classification scheme drop down to change the way the data is sorted into your categories.

3. Use the color selector to change the color used to display your categories on the map.

4. The transparency slider will allow you to change the thematic legend so you can see underlying features.


* To apply your changes, you must click the 'Apply Changes' button


In some instances, we have multiple years of the selected variable. In these cases, you can use the dropdown year tool to switch between these years.

page.name: print
page.content:
Print Map Editor

On this page, you can customize you map in preparation for export.

1. Click on the title and subtitle to give your map the name you want.

2. Clcik in the description box to write any details or narrative you want to include with the map.

3. The map remains interactive, so click on the map to pan and scroll until you get the look you want.

4. You have three options for export. To print your map as a pdf, click print map. If you want to use your own layout tools or embed this map in a powerpoint, use the export just map and legend buttons to grab .png images.
